decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 3063-DR-0100-SITE LOCATION PLAN; -3063-DR-0101-BLOCK PLAN; 3063-DR-3000-EXISTING FRONT & REAR ELEVATION; 3063-DR-3100-PROPOSED FRONT & REAR ELEVATIONS; 3063-DR-8100-WINDOW SCHEDULE; 3063-DR-8101-EXISTING & PROPOSED CASEMENT WINDOW DETAILS; 3063-DR-8102-EXISTING & PROPOSED CASEMENT WINDOWS - CROSS SECTION
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be as per the submitted application form or approved drawings (Condition 2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19), policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) - sections 12 and 16.
| The proposed windows shall adopt hinges that are recessed into the casement and painted to match the colour of the casement instead of exposed metal or brass hinges.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19), policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) - sections 12 and 16, and Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2008).
| The proposed glazing shall be 14mm (4:6:4) thick as per the submitted drawings (Condition 2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19), policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) - sections 12 and 16, and Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2008).
description: Replacement of existing single glazed white timber framed casement windows with double-glazed white timber framed casement windows to front and rear elevations
